title: Definitions
context: [ยง668A-2] Definitions. As used in this chapter: &ldquo;Ascendant&rdquo; means an individual who precedes another individual in lineage, in the direct line of ascent from the other individual. &ldquo;Collateral&rdquo; means an individual who is related to another individual under the law of intestate succession of this State, but who is not the other individual&rsquo;s ascendant or descendant. &ldquo;Descendant&rdquo; means an individual who follows another individual in lineage, in the direct line of descent from the other individual. &ldquo;Determination of value&rdquo; means an order of a court determining the fair market value of heirs property under section 668A-7 or 668A-11 or adopting the valuation of the property agreed to by all cotenants. &ldquo;Heirs property&rdquo; means real property held in tenancy in common that satisfies all the following requirements as of the filing of an action for partition: (1) There is no agreement in a record binding all the cotenants that governs the partition of the property; (2) One or more of the cotenants acquired title from a relative, whether living or deceased; and (3) Any of the following applies: (A) Twenty per cent or more of the interests are held by cotenants who are relatives; (B) Twenty per cent or more of the interests are held by an individual who acquired title from a relative, whether living or deceased; or &copy; Twenty per cent or more of the cotenants are relatives. &ldquo;Partition by sale&rdquo; means a court-ordered sale of the entire heirs property, whether by auction, sealed bids, or open-market sale conducted under section 668A-11. &ldquo;Partition in kind&rdquo; means the division of heirs property into physically distinct and separately titled parcels. &ldquo;Record&rdquo; means information that is inscribed on a tangible medium or that is stored in an electronic or other medium and is retrievable in perceivable form. &ldquo;Relative&rdquo; means an ascendant, descendant, or collateral or an individual otherwise related to another individual by blood, marriage, adoption, or law of this State other than this chapter.
